text: when I was growing up there was a local
story it was a country stores about a
mile and a half from my house and I used
to ride my bicycle there and at the end
of my long trek on my bicycle I would
get a treat and for me it was almost
always a Fudgsicle my personal favorite
today I'm making a version tastes almost
like it did when I was a kid maybe even
better start off by whisking together
two teaspoons of cornstarch that's going
to add some texture and thickness with
just a little bit of milk a couple
tablespoons and once the cornstarch has
dissolved you can add the rest of your
liquid a cup and a half of whole milk
and a cup and a half of Shh tell anybody
heavy cream that's what makes it so good
it's okay it's a treat then you're going
to want to add some sweetness 1/2 a cup
of sugar and half a cup of cocoa powder
this can lump up a little bit so just
whisk it until all the lumps go away
dissolve and don't forget to add a
little bit of salt so I always add just
a bit to enhance the flavors of almost
anything including desserts now all you
need to do is bring this to a boil and
make sure that you whisk it constantly
so that it doesn't scorch on the bottom
and the cornstarch that's in there will
thicken it just a little bit and that
will give it a really great texture when
it's frozen ok so be careful because
when the mixture comes to a boil
it could easily boil over so be super
careful about that because nothing's
worse than cleaning boiled milk off of
your stove add 2 teaspoons of vanilla
extract it's a great balance of flavor
chocolate and vanilla go so well
together to make it easy to pour your
mixture into your popsicle molds I
suggest putting it into a large glass
measuring cup if you have one it really
does make it easy I just let it cool off
just a little bit divide it evenly
between 10 molds these popsicle molds
come in ten so we've made the recipe so
that it fits these come with these
little tops that will hold the popsicle
sticks in their place just take your
popsicle sticks and stick them in and
then you can freeze them it just takes a
couple of hours
that's it then just put these in the
freezer for about six hours or until
